Issues.Title: Remove ANSI methods from the message loop
Issues.Body:
While fiddling with hosting VB6 controls I hit asserts regarding the message window changing unicode/ansi state. Investigating it was a result of the HWND changing as we make various peek/get calls for messages. I could track this and use the various APIs, but this flipping back and forth is most likely an artifact of Win9x (guessing hat is on here). Windows does the translation automatically:

https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-iswindowunicode#remarks

The VB6 control (which has an ANSI window) works just fine with these changes. It simplifies the logic and will speed up the message loop at least a little.

Removes the old GetMessage/PeekMessage defines in favor of CsWin32.

Also remove redundant </inheritdoc> labels- docs are automatically inherited from the interface when explicitly implementing.

cc: @lonitra 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8173)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove ANSI methods from the message loop" (#8173)

Issues.Body:
Related: #8184

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8186)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use ObjectDisposedException.ThrowIf in more places" (#8186)

Issues.Title: Use `ObjectDisposedException.ThrowIf` in more places
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

`ObjectDisposedException.ThrowIf` was introduced in .NET7, we should make use of it in more places.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.objectdisposedexception.throwif?view=net-7.0

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

n/a

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

n/a
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use `ObjectDisposedException.ThrowIf` in more places" (#8184)

Issues.Title: GridError dialog missing AutoScaleDimensions property
Issues.Body:
GridError dialog is missing `AutoScaleDimension` property resulting in default scale factor `1`. Thus, not scaled according to the DPI of the primary monitor. This property is auto generated if dialog was designed in the designer.

Fixes #5111 .
